sentences.sentence: The Water of Life
Once upon a time there was a king who was very sick, and everyone thought he was going to die.
He had three sons who were very upset( 难过的 ) about his sickness, and went into the palace garden to discuss what they should do.
There they met an old man who asked them what was the matter.
They told him that their father was so ill that he would almost certainly die, for nothing seemed to cure( 治愈 ) him.
Then the old man said, “I know of one thing that can cure him, and that is the Water of Life. If he drinks of it he will become well again, but it is hard to find.”
The eldest son said, “I will find it.”
He went to the sick King, and asked to be allowed to go out into the world and look for the Water of Life, because only in that way could the King be saved.
“No,” said the King, “the danger of it is too great. I would rather die.”
But the Prince( 王子 ) kept asking for so long that the King agreed.
The Prince thought in his heart, “If I bring the water, then I shall be my father’s favorite, and inherit( 继承 ) the kingdom.”
So he set out, and when he had gone a little distance, a dwarf( 小矮人 ) stood there on the road who called to him and said, “Where are you going?”
“Silly little man,” said the Prince, very proudly, “it is nothing to do with you,” and rode on.
That made the little dwarf angry, and so he wished an evil( 邪恶的 ) wish.
Soon after this the prince entered a steep( 陡峭的 ), narrow( 狭窄的 ) valley( 山谷 ), and the further he rode in, the closer the mountains drew together.
At last the road became so narrow that he could not go a step further.
There was no room either to turn his horse or to get off it, and he was shut in there as if in prison( 监狱 ).
The sick King waited a long time for him, but he did not return.
Then the second son said, “Father, let me go out into the world to look for the Water of Life.”
And he thought to himself, “If my brother is dead, then the kingdom will come to me.”
At first the King would not allow him to go either, but at last he agreed.
So the Prince set out on the same road that his brother had taken, and he too met the dwarf, who stopped him to ask, “Where are you going in such a hurry?
“Silly little man,” said the Prince, “that is no business of yours,” and rode on without giving him another look.
But the dwarf cast( 施魔法 ) a magic spell on him, and he, like his brother, rode into a steep, narrow valley, and could neither go forward nor back.
That is the kind of thing that happens to people who are too proud.
As the second son did not come back either, the youngest asked to be allowed to go and search for the Water of Life, and at last the King agreed to let him go.

When he met the dwarf, and the dwarf asked him where he was going in such a hurry, he stopped and explained. “I am seeking( 寻找 ) the Water of Life, because my father is sick, and I am afraid he may die.”
“Do you know, then, where it is to be found?”
“No,” said the Prince.
“As you have behaved( 表现 ) properly, and not rudely( 无礼的 ) like your brothers, I will tell you how you can find the Water of Life.
It springs from a fountain( 喷泉 ) in the courtyard( 庭院 ) of an enchanted( 被施了魔法的 ) castle( 城堡 ), but to find it you will need an iron wand( 魔杖 ) and two small loaves( 条 ) of bread.
Strike three times with the wand on the iron door of the castle and it will spring open.
Inside lie two lions with their mouths wide open( 大张的 ) .
But if you throw a loaf to each of them, they will not bother( 烦扰 ) you.
Then hurry to fetch( 取 ) some of the Water of Life before the clock strikes twelve.
Otherwise the door will shut again, and you will be trapped( 被困住 ).”

question.cn: 下列关于生命之水的说法中，哪项是正确的？
question.en: Which of the following statements about the Water of Life was true?

options.en: It could not cure the King.

analysis: 文中提到：“I know of one thing that can cure him, and that is the Water of Life. If he drinks of it he will become well again, but it is hard to find.”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 为什么小矮人告诉小王子怎么找到生命之水？
question.en: Why did the dwarf tell the third how to find the Water of Life?

options.cn: 因为小王子举止礼貌得体。

options.en: Because the third asked him for help.

analysis: 文中提到：“As you have behaved properly, and not rudely like your brothers, I will tell you how you can find the Water of Life.”小矮人认为小王子变现得体有礼，因此主动告诉小王子怎么找到生命之水，因此答案选B。

question.cn: 为了找到生命之水，王子需要什么？
question.en: What did the Prince need in order to find the Water of Life?

analysis: 文中提到：“It springs from a fountain in the courtyard of an enchanted castle, but to find it you will need an iron wand and two small loaves of bread.” 因此答案选C。
